item.title: 美国环保局公布废除美国温室气体管制权的计划
item.description: 特朗普政府正式提议取消美国政府将温室气体作为空气污染物进行监管的权力，此举将严重削弱华盛顿应对气候变化的能力。【原文：The Trump administration is formally proposing to scrap the US government’s authority to regulate greenhouse gases as an air pollutant, a move that sets the stage to severely weaken Washington’s ability to fight climate change.】

item.title: 气候影响 X 公司首席执行官表示，"绿化 "可使成本保持较高水平
item.description: 碳交易所 "气候影响 X"（Climate Impact X）负责人表示，企业减少谈论气候行动的举动可能会阻碍削减减排成本的努力。【原文：Moves by companies to talk less about climate action may stall efforts to cut the cost of emissions reductions, according to the head of carbon exchange Climate Impact X.】

item.title: 沙特计划再建一座耗资数十亿美元的绿色氢气厂
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯的 Acwa 电力公司计划建造王国第二座耗资数十亿美元的绿色制氢厂，尽管第一个项目的产出销售困难重重。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s Acwa Power Co. plans to build the kingdom’s second multibillion-dollar green hydrogen plant, despite struggles to sell output from the first project.】

item.title: 美国首艘海上风电电缆船在特朗普的阴影下开始工作
item.description:
一艘悬挂美国国旗的驳船上的船员将铺设电缆，将帝国风力发电厂与纽约市电网连接起来，这对于一个陷入困境的行业来说是一个里程碑。【原文：

The crew of an American-flagged barge will lay cable to connect the Empire Wind farm to New York City’s grid — a milestone for an embattled sector.  

】

item.title: 澳大利亚推进清洁能源计划以实现可再生能源的宏伟目标
item.description: 澳大利亚将把其旗舰清洁能源计划扩大四分之一，以实现到本十年末可再生能源发电量翻一番的宏伟目标。【原文：Australia will expand its flagship clean power program by a quarter to meet an ambitious target to more than double renewable energy generation by the end of the decade.】

item.title: 香港一周内第二次因暴雨停业
item.description: 在台风吹倒金融中心的树木一周多之后，香港发布了最高级别的暴雨警告，实际上关闭了整个城市。【原文：Hong Kong issued its highest rainstorm warning, effectively closing down the city, just over a week after a typhoon downed trees in the financial center.】

item.title: 北京降雨致 30 人死亡，习近平敦促努力保护生命安全
item.description: 随着中国东部和中部地区面临更加恶劣的天气，暴雨已导致北京 30 人死亡，并切断了一些村庄的电力供应。【原文：Heavy rainfall has led to 30 deaths in Beijing and cut power to some villages as eastern and central parts of China face more wild weather, with President Xi Jinping urging authorities to keep people safe.】

item.title: 耗资 1000 亿美元建设东南亚超级电网背后的隐藏障碍
item.description:
老挝山区的一个项目使该地区离庞大的互联能源网络又近了一步

。【原文：

A project in the mountains of Laos is bringing the region one step closer to a vast, interconnected energy network

】

item.title: 中国的煤炭管道有可能造成过剩，破坏气候目标
item.description: 据《全球能源观察》报道，中国拟议的煤矿开发项目有可能造成供过于求，破坏气候目标。【原文：China’s proposed coal mine developments risk creating an oversupply and derailing climate goals, according to Global Energy Monitor.】

item.title: 美国环保局将瓦解美国监管温室气体的权力
item.description: 特朗普政府即将宣布废除美国政府管制温室气体权力的计划，这有可能对华盛顿应对气候变化的能力造成沉重打击。【原文：The Trump administration is set to announce its plans to abolish the US government’s authority to regulate greenhouse gases, threatening to strike a deep blow at Washington’s ability to fight climate change.】

item.title: S.非洲获得 5 亿欧元德国贷款用于化石燃料行动
item.description: 南非从德国获得了 5 亿欧元（5.82 亿美元）的贷款，以帮助其摆脱对化石燃料的依赖。【原文：South Africa got a €500 million ($582 million) loan from Germany to help it fund its shift away from its reliance on fossil fuels.】

item.title: 炙热高温威胁美国近一半地区的电网和健康
item.description: 由于从芝加哥到纽约市和新奥尔良的气温和湿度飙升，本周大部分时间里，美国近一半的地区都将在炎热、粘稠的环境中萎靡不振，从而增加了电力需求和健康风险。【原文：Nearly half the US will wilt under hot, sticky conditions through the bulk of the week as temperatures and humidity soar from Chicago to New York City and New Orleans, boosting power demand and raising health risks.】

item.title: 特朗普数十亿美元的气候削减令非营利组织苟延残喘
item.description:
从清洁能源、研究到宣传，非营利组织正因联邦资金枯竭而陷入困境。基金会表示，他们无法填补资金缺口。【原文：

From clean energy and research to advocacy, nonprofit groups are struggling as federal dollars dry up. Foundations say they won’t be able to fill funding gaps.

】

item.title: 干旱导致供应紧张，伊朗再次面临供水危机
item.description: 伊朗正面临有史以来最严重的干旱之一，年降雨量的大幅下降迫使当局限制全国的供应。【原文：Iran is facing one of its worst droughts on record as a major drop in annual rainfall forces authorities to restrict supply across the country.】

item.title: 欧盟与特朗普达成的怪兽级能源协议看来难以实现
item.description: 欧盟承诺在三年内购买 7500 亿美元的美国进口能源，这是与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普达成贸易协议的关键，但欧盟将很难兑现这一承诺。【原文：The European Union’s promise to buy $750 billion of American energy imports over three years was pivotal to securing a trade deal with President Donald Trump, but it’s a pledge it will struggle to keep.】

item.title: 北京敦促居民留在室内，因为一夜之间雨量将达到一英尺
item.description: 北京当局警告说，中国首都部分地区周一晚间的降雨量可能超过 300 毫米（12 英寸），并敦促居民留在室内。【原文：Authorities in Beijing warned that parts of the Chinese capital could see more than 300 millimeters (12 inches) of rain on Monday evening, urging residents to stay indoors.】

item.title: 野火肆虐土耳其，威胁地中海，四人死亡
item.description: 连日来，灼热的气温和强风引发的野火肆虐土耳其和希腊部分地区，造成四人死亡，数百名居民和游客被迫逃离火海。【原文：Wildfires driven by searing temperatures and strong winds ravaged Turkey and parts of Greece in recent days, leaving four people dead and forcing hundreds of residents and tourists to flee the flames.】

item.title: 苏格兰风电场展示如何应对乡巴佬的反对意见
item.description:
刘易斯岛的项目停滞了几十年，但当地领导人坚持不懈的努力克服了监管障碍和社区关切。【原文：

Projects on the Isle of Lewis were stalled for decades, but the perseverance of local leaders overcame regulatory obstacles and community concerns.

】

item.title: 东南亚森林火灾骤增，雾霾风险加剧
item.description: 据一份新的报告称，由于农产品价格上涨促使公司提高种植园的产量，今年森林火灾的增加可能会在东南亚造成严重的雾霾。【原文：A rise in forest-clearing fires could cause severe haze in Southeast Asia this year, according to a new report, as elevated agricultural commodity prices motivate companies to boost output from their plantations.】

item.title: 美国东部有超过 1.32 亿人面临酷热天气
item.description: 本周伊始，美国中部和东部地区超过 1.32 亿人将面临酷热的气温，湿度的上升使天气更加糟糕，空调和风扇的工作也给能源网带来了压力。【原文：More than 132 million people across the central and eastern US are facing blistering temperatures to start the week, with rising humidity making it feel even worse and putting a strain on the energy grid as air conditioners and fans get a workout.】

item.title: 英国绿党在领导人竞选中面临民粹主义之争
item.description: 三位候选人正在争夺英国绿党的下一任领导人。他们一致认为，英国日益分裂的政治格局创造了一个机会，但在如何抓住这个机会上却存在分歧。【原文：Three candidates are battling to become the next leader of the UK’s Green Party. They agree Britain’s increasingly fractured political landscape creates an opportunity — but are divided on how to seize it.】

item.title: 德国人终于开始使用空调了，连租房者也不例外
item.description:
租户在适应新的气候现实方面面临着有限的选择。【原文：

Tenants face limited options in adapting to the new climate reality.

】

item.title: 德国削减预算让重工业与肮脏技术无缘
item.description: 在德国西部工业中心的一个小镇盖塞克，在当地一家水泥厂启动大规模碳捕集项目的计划已被搁置。【原文：In Geseke, a small town in Germany’s western industrial heartland, plans to launch a large-scale carbon capture project at a local cement plant have been put on ice.】

item.title: 酷热将增加美国中部和东部的电力需求
item.description: 预计为期一周的热浪将给美国中部和东部大部分地区带来闷热的气温和高湿度，给电力和铁路基础设施造成负担，因此电力价格正在攀升。【原文：Power prices are climbing in anticipation of a week-long heat wave expected to bring sweltering temperatures and high humidity to much of the central and eastern United States, taxing power and rail infrastructure.】

item.title: 德国热泵销量首次超过燃气锅炉
item.description: 在德国，热泵的销量首次超过了燃气锅炉，因为禁止使用不清洁的供暖系统迫使人们转向使用更清洁的能源。【原文：Sales of heat pumps in Germany surpassed gas boilers for the first time as a ban on dirty heating systems forces a shift to cleaner energy.】

item.title: 欧洲极右翼人士称应拒绝 2040 年气候目标
item.description: 负责领导议会谈判的极右翼团体认为，欧盟提出的到 2040 年减排 90% 的目标应该被否决。【原文：The European Union’s proposed target to cut emissions by 90% by 2040 should be rejected, according to the far-right grouping responsible for leading negotiations in parliament.】

item.title: 伦敦通勤环境尚未做好应对气候变化的准备
item.description: 今天的时事通讯关注彭博社伦敦地铁热指数的最新数据，该指数由我们的天气和气候记者乔-韦尔兹（Joe Wertz）在初夏推出。数据显示，自他开始记录以来，每天从金融中心出发的热门工作日行程都在热浪范围内。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读并与您的朋友和粉丝分享这个故事。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at the latest data from Bloomberg’s London Tube Heat Index, which was launched by our weather and climate reporter Joe Wertz at the start of summer. It shows a popular weekday journey from the financial center has stayed within heat wave conditions every day since he started recording. You can read and share this story with your friends and followers on Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 伦敦中央线每天都在炙烤着城市乘客
item.description:
布鲁姆伯格的伦敦地铁热指数显示，今年夏天，从金融中心出发的热门工作日 旅程 每天都在热浪范围内。【原文：

Bloomberg’s London Tube Heat Index shows a popular weekday journey from the financial center has stayed within heat wave conditions every day this summer.

】

item.title: 规模达 17 万亿美元的基金负责人认为 ESG 扩展可带来回报
item.description: 日本 249.8 万亿日元（约合 1.7 万亿美元）的养老基金是世界顶级绿色投资者之一，该基金表示，与环境、社会和公司治理相关的投资发展到更广泛的目标，有助于支持回报和经济增长。【原文：An evolution of ESG-related investment to address a wider set of objectives can help support returns and economic growth, according to Japan’s ¥249.8 trillion ($1.7 trillion) pension fund that ranks among the world’s top green investors.】

item.title: 水务公司利用太阳能电池板减少蒸发损失
item.description:
澳大利亚的供应商正在对浮动面板进行测试，以冷却水库并最大限度地减少造成浪费的最大原因。【原文：

Suppliers in Australia are testing floating panels to cool down reservoirs and minimize their largest cause of wastage.

】
